title: Some attestations fail to include in chain
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description Some attestations fail even if logs indicate that attestation got submitted. Looks like this happens for all my accounts. **Steps I consider, will report later:** 1) disable external slasher protection on service validator https://github.com/stefa2k/prysm-docker-compose/blob/5f025af7d18dfaab599fc09f0cf569ff6bb8829a/config/ha/validator-wallet.yaml#L15 -> **didn't work, also loosing attestations** 2) disable local detection on service validator https://github.com/stefa2k/prysm-docker-compose/blob/5f025af7d18dfaab599fc09f0cf569ff6bb8829a/config/ha/validator-wallet.yaml#L13 -> begin test at 2020-07-22 9:00 UTC -> ~~**seems to work, no more missing attestations**~~ **doesn't work** 3) disable slasher completely -> **not working** ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes, worked with docker tag `HEAD-e0c803` and previous versions ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Error Unfortunately no errors. Validator log: ``` time="2020-07-22 06:39:56" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[] AttesterIndices=[10584 10174 10399] BeaconBlockRoot=0xa9ff679b29af CommitteeIndex=1 Slot=274012 SourceEpoch=8561 SourceRoot=0x0a999e6d763b TargetEpoch=8562 TargetRoot=0xaf80784bce8b prefix=validator ``` https://beaconscan.com/onyx/slot/274012#attestations but 10174 still missed the attestation. ## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 20.04
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
docker tag `HEAD-367738`
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** index 10174 public key 0xb00411b66e7dc0a5ded34607dbf4a9cffca78d05169f600a3b0c1a590fb182888e0f742e74939ad376a2b1a1c66e7093

Additional logs

Validator logs

`time="2020-07-22 00:51:32" level=error msg="rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not insert proposer slashing 
into pool: slashing object already exists in pending proposer slashings" prefix=beaconclient

into pool: could not verify proposer slashing: validator with key 0xaa8c6a83a494b6e95523d3110f41875a3a5aee2eeeeb0

last saved block: highest saved block does not equal to 1, it equals to 2" prefix=beaconclient`

Running latest beacon and validator. Beacon runs with --dev

happened again with validator no. 2107:
```
    time="2020-08-04 16:44:12" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[] AttesterIndices=[2425 2623 2817 2835 2356 2944 2107 2097 2899] BeaconBlockRoot=0xa43745a65167 CommitteeIndex=0 Slot=1120 SourceEpoch=34 SourceRoot=0x65ec48482607 TargetEpoch=35 TargetRoot=0xa43745a65167 prefix=validator
```

but shown as missed: https://beaconcha.in/validator/945d36ce4fcfc03b056ad950e9fb330ea107afc83789241dd7dfcc515d7ee9a9110477b3596a7842681a62a43eb98d4c#attestations

It is included. I found the attestation by 2107. It's included in block 1122 
See:  https://beaconcha.in/block/1122#pills-attestations

![Screen Shot 2020-08-04 at 10 14 03 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21316537/89323867-3a6f2b00-d63b-11ea-83e7-5927517cfda6.png)

It looks more like a status display bug on `https://beaconcha.in/validator/`

> happened again with validator no. 2107:
> 
> ```
>     time="2020-08-04 16:44:12" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[] AttesterIndices=[2425 2623 2817 2835 2356 2944 2107 2097 2899] BeaconBlockRoot=0xa43745a65167 CommitteeIndex=0 Slot=1120 SourceEpoch=34 SourceRoot=0x65ec48482607 TargetEpoch=35 TargetRoot=0xa43745a65167 prefix=validator
> ```
> 
> but shown as missed: https://beaconcha.in/validator/945d36ce4fcfc03b056ad950e9fb330ea107afc83789241dd7dfcc515d7ee9a9110477b3596a7842681a62a43eb98d4c#attestations

It shows as attested now:
https://beaconcha.in/validator/945d36ce4fcfc03b056ad950e9fb330ea107afc83789241dd7dfcc515d7ee9a9110477b3596a7842681a62a43eb98d4c#attestations

Seems like the attested status is lagged
Thanks, yes, I could verify it with 2 more. Looks like its a bug in beaconcha.in.

Happened again, will have an eye on it but I think its simply a display bug of beaconcha.in

Thanks!

Looks like its still there:
https://beaconcha.in/validator/b1c8c3ac9508bb170200b25b7222b3f985e7bdfe86584e77ca121b9e2709e285a60f32769cffa6dcde18920bdf96ddcd#attestations (validator 2085)
Slot 3844: https://beaconscan.com/slot/3844#votes
log:
```
time="2020-08-05 01:49:00" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[] AttesterIndices=[2085 2805 2751 2803 2430] BeaconBlockRoot=0xb33d1a8783b0 CommitteeIndex=1 Slot=3844 SourceEpoch=119 SourceRoot=0x51c75628a73c TargetEpoch=120 TargetRoot=0xa25ca59b37af prefix=validator
```
I'll write a debug end point to better understand this problem

> Looks like its still there:
> https://beaconcha.in/validator/b1c8c3ac9508bb170200b25b7222b3f985e7bdfe86584e77ca121b9e2709e285a60f32769cffa6dcde18920bdf96ddcd#attestations (validator 2085)
> Slot 3844: https://beaconscan.com/slot/3844#votes
> log:
> 
> ```
> time="2020-08-05 01:49:00" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[] AttesterIndices=[2085 2805 2751 2803 2430] BeaconBlockRoot=0xb33d1a8783b0 CommitteeIndex=1 Slot=3844 SourceEpoch=119 SourceRoot=0x51c75628a73c TargetEpoch=120 TargetRoot=0xa25ca59b37af prefix=validator
> ```

Updates:
 * I added a debug endpoint in #6895 for observatory. I can confirm that all your missed attestations were never included in the chain. Hence this is not a block chain explorer's issue, this is a networking and/or protocol issue.
 * @prestonvanloon has been working on an improvement fix for this in #6893, we are confident that will solve this issue
Hi @stefa2k we have since then significantly improved this code path. Let us know if this issue still persists and we will reopen as needed
